text: This was recommended to us by several people so we figured it had to be good. Aside from the manager that came by to check on us, not a single employee smiled. The bartenders actually rolled their eyes at us and walked away instead of serving us. Waitress was annoyed with the fact that we were ordering a bunch of appetizers instead of dinners. They weren't prepared at all to handle the volume of a sold out concert despite sitting in the shadow of Heinz Field. How do you not know there's a concert going on and prepare accordingly? I know that you are in the service industry and things can get hectic, however you need to at least smile or act like you'd like to work there. Extremely disappointing service, I would never recommend this to anyone.

My mom and I were spending a girl's night out and decided to check out this restaurant prior to the Pirate game.  We planned ahead and got in line via No Wait, as I anticipated this being a popular spot on a Friday night.  We arrived at the restaurant and I checked in as the app instructed me to do.  The hostesses seemed overwhelmed already (it was only 5 pm) and not one of them politely greeted us.  One asked me if I selected indoor, outdoor or no preference when I registered online.  I said, I'm sorry I didn't as that wasn't an option when I got in line.  She looked super annoyed, rolled her eyes and said, "That's what I'm asking you." So I apologized again (something wrong with this picture here...) and requested outside.  At that point, there were four parties ahead of us.  We waited another 15 minutes before our table was ready.  Once we were alerted, I returned to the hostess desk, informed them that my table was ready.  At this point, there were 4 employees standing at the desk, not busy serving other customers.  One said, you have to now check in with the outside host desk.  Having never been there before, I did not know where that was exactly, so I asked if someone could show us.  One employee, also seemingly annoyed (I'm sensing a pattern here...), lifted his arm and literally pointed at the front door.  Incredulous, I said I needed someone to physically show me the way - not point outside.  We were then  directed outside to the appropriate area, and the next hostess was far friendlier and lead us promotly to our table.  

The table wasn't actually ready, as there was still debris and remnants from the previous diners.  So the hostess bussed the table and we settled in.  At this point, it was 1 hour and 45 minutes prior to the start of the game - plenty of time to enjoy the beautiful weather.  We were greeted fairly promptly by our waitress, she was very friendly, and our drink orders were taken.  We acknowledged that we were going to the game.  It took a solid 15 minutes for her to return with our drinks and take our dinner order.  She apologized for the wait, and we said no problem because at the point we had the whole night ahead of us.  That turned out to be the shortest wait of the evening.  And our waitress became less pleasant and present from that point forward.

We ordered three apps total and a salad.  Our first two appetizers arrived 30 minutes later (?!) and at that point our glasses were bone dry.  We asked for water, which took another 15 minutes.  It's important to note that while the restaurant was somewhat busy, not all of the tables were occupied in our area and it appeared to be well staffed.  

It took another 35 minutes to receive our dinner (remember a salad and an appetizer of tacos), and we were starting to get very annoyed.  My mom's salad came without dressing, so the waitress went back to retrieve it.  Not sure if she got lost, but that took an unnecessarily long time as well.  Unfortunately, the game was fast approaching, so we hurriedly ate (not at all how we envisioned this going) and asked for the check.  We also asked for a take out box, as the portions were very generous.  Our waitress served two tables, going in and out, before finally bringing us our check. Guess what, no box.  She served two more tables, in and out, before taking our check and bringing boxes.  At this point, we were 5 minutes from game time, very frustrated and certainly not relaxed.  

The food at Jerome Bettis Grille 36 was tasty and generously portioned.  However, the staff was hugely disappointing from the moment we walked in to the moment we hurriedly rushed out.  Despite being well staffed, it appeared disorganized and poorly managed.  The host staff was incredibley rude and the wait staff was not attentive or responsive to our very basic needs.  I will not return to this restaurant for future pre-game meals, nor would I recommend it to anyone interested in spending their time wisely.  

Jerome - the city loves you and we are proud of you, but your restaurant staff is letting you down.  I can't imagine these are your standards and you are going to need to act quickly to turn this around before the next influx of sports fans unknowingly settles in.

This place was great!!! The food was very good. There not cheap on there portions either !! The atmosphere was great, during and not during game times. 
We stayed there for three days, and we ate there every night. You got to have the nachos!!! They are very large. You got to try Iron City Beer. I'm a big beer drinker, and I love this beer.

You won't be disappointed!!!

This review is with respect to the carrot cake, only: It's pretty awesome.  For $9 you get enough cake to feed 4 normal people, or maybe 2 happily indulgent people.  Either way, gigantic chunks of walnuts, and tasty cream cheese frosting makes for a happy camper in my books.  Yum.
This is a really great place to eat. Very clean reasonable prices & the portions are huge. The staff is friendly & helpful.
Been here several times. I am not a drinker, here for food. Decent size serving. The slice of carrot cake was humongous! It was very good non the less.

The food is average and the service is slow.  The ambiance is awesome,  it's not enough to cover for the slow service though.  Try the deep fried burger,  and a Boilermaker,  you won't be disappointed. But don't plan on getting out quickly. They are slow.
Every time I come into town this is a must stop for me.  The drinks are great and it always has a nice friendly crowd before and after sporting events.  Total thumbs up in my book.

Had a very poor experience there related to customer service. 

Arrived to to get seating for a large table at 12:30pm.  They said they would not take names and hold tables. There were limited large tables open at that time, but only two of eight in our party had arrived so they wouldn't seat us.  We mentioned our party was expected around 1.  Around 1 they started a wait list and were not helpful when we asked to be listed on it.  They had not looked to save any large tables or opportunities to hold our group and were very rude when we asked again to try and be seated.  The rest of our party showed by 1:15 and it included 3 kids. At that time, there was nowhere for us to sit.   By 2pm, they had not followed up with us at all or tried to be courteous.  In fact, they were very unprofessional during the entire process.  I complained to the management since they "had no idea" about how long it would be to try and seat us. While I waited for more than an hour, they still made no effort to hold smaller tables open to try and accommodate our party.  By just after 2pm we said we were leaving and they seemed shocked.  Was also very frustrated the manager did not really try to solve any issues and help us out.  

I didn't even get to eat there but my co-workers had lunch there other days and said their meals were "OK." 

They need to improve their approach to seating and customer service.  If they would have been more accommodating we would have been a large party with huge orders.  Instead, they ruined our day and their reputation among a large group of potential customers.
Upscale atmosphere, great selection of adult beverages and great food. Boneless wings are some of the best I have had. The Asian chicken salad was awesome.

My boyfriend and I just moved to Pittsburgh, all the way from Montana.  We were having lunch at Jerome Bettis Grille 36, and we asked our bartender, Matt, if there was any chance they would be showing the Montana State / Stony Brook playoff game later that night.  As Montana State alumni (Go Cats!), we are big fans, but being this far away from home, we didn't figure there was any way we would be able to see the game.  If so, our plan was to return later that evening to hang out and watch the game.  Matt went above and beyond to make sure that their AV guy, Taylor, would be able to put the game on for us.  Not only that, but Matt knew that he would be off his shift when we returned.  So he talked to the other bartenders that were coming on duty that evening - Dave, Nick, and Sean - to make sure they knew to expect us.  Sure enough, when we walked in later that evening, Dave remembered us, and had them turn the game on for us.  Not only that, but the manager on duty came up to us and asked if  everything was ok for us, and if the TV that they were showing it on was close enough.  Awesome!  PLUS, the AV guy - Taylor - stopped by where we were sitting and asked if we could see the feed clearly enough.  We definitely could.  Long story short....  The service was phenomenal!  Thank you to everyone - Matt, Dave, Nick, Sean, Taylor, and the manager on duty the afternoon and evening of 12/1/12 (sorry - we didn't get your name!).  All of you made 2 people who are a long way from home not only feel welcome, but right at home.  We are impressed, and we will definitely be back.

I haven't been in a few years and happened to be back in town with my fiancé. After walking around the point - we headed over for lunch. 

We were seated quickly, our server Cory was friendly, attentive, and very helpful! Our food was delicious (burger & shrimp tacos) It was a beautiful day to sit outside - their outside patio is in a great spot. 

We will definitely be back the next time we are in town!

This place is the best. Came in last night and our bar tender Chris was the best. Service was five star.  Had the shrimp tacos they were very good. So got up this afternoon and went back. The bar tender was different but still a five star server. Didn't have to ask for a refill was their when I needed it. Also had the fish tacos again. Will be coming back to Pittsburgh just to come here and I'm from Dayton Ohio. Much love

Atmosphere. That's what this place has. If you want to go to a top notch sports bar, Jerome Bettis Grille is the place in Pittsburgh.

An excellent bar, with over 30 beers on tap,many being craft beers. Big selection of liquor and a good wine selection. The bartenders are awesome, very attentive and quick. 

Lots of tv's to watch your favourite sports events. The lounge and patio are spacious with both lots of standing and sitting room.

The restaurant has lots of seating and wonderful food.  The menu has a great variety of choices to please all palates.  You have to definitely try the deep fried pretzels...they are amazing!!  If you're up for the challenge, try the 36....and kudos to you if you finish it.

There were a few reviews that said the food here was 'pub' style.  We thought the food was definitely a few notches above that.  We all had something different and the food was fabulous.

We will be back!!!!!!
The wait was almost 2 hrs. But the service was decent. The food may have been alright but they got my order wrong. The environment is nice.

Even though I'm not a football fan (sorry!), I ended up having the greatest lunch here.

Whatever you do, start with the pretzels! They were out of this world. Enough said. Just do it.

I went for the Sesame Ginger chicken salad, and I don't regret it. A little spicy, a little juicy and a bunch of green goodies - this lunch was exactly what I wanted. Would not mind going here for dinner, I'd love to try out some of the beers they have here. There is a lot to choose from. 

The whole place was neat and clean (restrooms, too), pretty good for a sportsbar! It left me impressed.

Was enjoying a summer day, listening to an outdoor concert at stage AE and decided to move over and sit outside of JBG and have some cocktails and appetizers with a friend. The service was wonderful, very polite host and our server was very helpful and fun. The food for the price is where I had issues. I had 3 beers (draft selection was pretty decent) but at 8$ a pop for each one (all different) was a bit much. 
Food wise:
started with the spinach artichoke dip...a little too creamy, but still good. 
Continued on with the short rib tacos which were maybe the worse tacos of my life. cold tortilla, little meat, and dry slaw mix. nothing at all interesting and certainly not worth the like 13$. I had to put the leftover spinach artichoke dip on top to give it any moisture. still only finished 1. 

So, location is great...food is meh...prices are as high, but service was wonderful. Won't be going back though

Went here with my ten month old and wife.  We thought was just a tourist trap type of place but it really surprised me! I love the combination of foods they have. Very good place and great service !

Actually went there twice during our four night stay in Pittsburgh.

I was a bit nervous to eat here since I have heard bad things about this place, but we decided to eat here before the death cab for cutie show. And I must say it was pretty good. I had the buffalo chicken sandwich which was good and had a few bites of the deep fried hoagie, also good. They had 2.50 dos equis which is a great price. I think they were 20 oz.? We all got the artichoke dip before hand. Big pieces of artichokes. Plus, you gotta love that when you take a piss, there is a 2 way mirror while doing so. Cant say I ever pissed and looked at people sitting at a bar before...well at least that I can remember. I might even consider watching a pittsburgh stinker game here this year

Stopped here for a late lunch while out doing the tourist thing. I thought there would be more memorabilia, not as crazy as a hard rock but something. 
They have some funky burgers, with funky meats and one that's coated in tempura batter and deep fried! 
Menu is pretty big with a nice selection of salads, soups and flatbread sandwiches, as well as apps and meals 
Hubby had the Turkey Devonshire 7.99 lunch special, 
grilled turkey, garlic mashed potatoes and buttermilk biscuits, topped with smoked bacon, cheddar jack cheese, and a parmesan cheese sauce, which he liked and was a good meal for a cold, rainy day. 

I had the Kobe burger 11.99, ordered medium, came well done but it was still good, came with purple potato chips and a parmesan dip/sandwhich spread that was really good. If we come back I'm getting the Ultimate Mac and Cheese 

They have a really nice cocktail menu and my Tropicotton cotton candy martini was awesome! A+ 

Oh, and my Hub also liked being able to look at the whole restaurant through a one way glass while he was peeing. Men...
Great place. Love going in to see the people I know who work there. The food is very good and another great location in the Burgh.
Love the Grille!  The Cedar Plank Salmon is great and the burgers are awesome. The manager and staff are always friendly and accommodating.

So we came here because you just "have to" when visiting Pittsburgh. It was a total let down and just horrible food! We had the nachos that the the waitress said they were "famous" for. I can make better nachos myself. If I hadn't had ranch to douse them in, they would have been inedible. The beer was warm. Just overall not a great experience and very sad that I had to rate it so low.

really cool place, down the street from heinz field.  huge bar on the inside, really large patio seating and the mensroom had a cool one-way mirror so you're lookin out into the restaurant while u pee.

huge menu with a lot of different choices.  some dishes have a 36 logo next to it signifying it was one of bettis' favorites.  so based on that, i chose the turkey burger since i actually never had one before.  i will never get it again.  it looked terrible when the waitress brought it over and it tasted terrible.  made me really question the bus' taste.

but the wings were really good.  my coworkers all ordered salads or wraps which looked pretty good.  they also have a good selection of beers and that day the special beer was $2.25 for a 20oz glass, which they said was pretty good (i didn't drink).

overall, a decent spot, but i'll just try somethin other than the turkey burger next time i go.

I came here because of good reviews and the fact I'm from out of town. I asked the waitress if I could get a burger without a bun, because I have Celiac disease. She informed me they had a gluten free menu! I was ecstatic that they had gluten free buns. I ordered a burger with the gluten free bun. We finally got our food and when I got mine I asked again if it was gluten free, the waitress confirmed yes. After I ate half the burger I was suspicious of the bun since it tasted too good. I asked the waitress again and she had it remade. It came back on a completely different bun. The one I received first was NOT gluten free. I immediately knew I was going to be sick. I told the waitress and she apologized. I got my bill and she still charged me for the burger. I honestly didn't eat any of the new burger because I felt so sick. After I explained to the waitress I thought it was ridiculous that I had to pay for a meal that I ate half of and was going to make me sick for days, she took it off. Just disappointed that they advertise gluten free buns and can't even make sure they give the customers the right ones.

Terrible experience yesterday Dec 27.  Arrived at Bettis' at about 1:25 pm.  (Know this because paid to park for 90 min at meter at 1:20). We had a group of six including 74 year old disabled mother and my brother's family visiting from Florida.  Not crowded at all as it was mid-afternoon on a Tuesday.  There was only one group in front of us , yet we waited over fifteen minutes to be seated and this despite the fact there were empty tables available on the riverview side.  Hostess claimed they didnt have enough servers in that section, so we had to wait for someone to leave on the streetside.  After viewing a quick table top wet towel smear, we were finally seated at that table.   Noticed that the carpeted floors were disgusting throughout the room...food all over them.

After almost 10 min the waitress breezed by us and said "i'll be right with you".  Never saw her again.  After another 10 minutes a couple from next table advised, "you seem like nice people...take our advice and get out while you can."  They said that they had long wait on a table, long wait to place order, long wait to get food, no service after food arrived, and yes, even a long wait to get their check.  They had been there well over an hour and a half. We thanked them and decided to leave.  Another table saw us leaving and they too left.  

As we were leaving, a young man appeared and asked what he could offer us to stay.  He began providing rationalizations as to why the service was so poor and actually followed me all the way to the door asking if we wanted a different table.  We asked if we could get better service, to which he had no response.  He then actually offered us coupons for our next visit.  Really?  We came in for a meal, not charity.   Won't be visiting again.  

We had an excellent customer service experience across the street at Burgatory.   BTW, thanks to the Bettis team, i also had to leave that meal to go back out to the car to feed the parking meter.

We went in on a Thursday at 7:30 PM and the place was a little dead on the inside, and the patio had about 15-20 people sitting outside eating.  The wait staff acted like they were slammed and took forever to give us menus, take our order, refill drinks, bring the check, etc.  My friend's wife ordered Sangria and said it tasted like they gave her pineapple juice that they had dyed with another juice to make it look like sangria.  She knows her wine, so I am sure she knew what she was talking about.  She actually returned the drink and ordered something else, and it took like 10 minutes to get her 2nd order which was just a glass of white wine!  Also when we first went into the restaurant, the host and hostess at the table just stood and looked at us like we were intruding.  It took them a couple minutes to greet us and ask if we wanted to be seated!  Moral of the story:  Get your shit together, Bettis Grille.  Maybe Jerome needs to check in on you more often.

Sports! Big Screens! Dj! Tater tots! More places should offer tater tots!!! Food and drinks were good. Bacon wrapped jalapeno poppers delicious. Our food came quickly, and was hot. Overall it was really good. The only reason I'm not rating a 5 is the hostess seating us wasn't especially nice, tho the waitress was great. The food was all delicious, but our "medium" burger was brought out "well done".

Food: The menu offers pretty much exactly what you would expect Jerome Bettis himself to eat, a lot of meat and hearty sides, but also features a surprising number of vegetarian choices for a grill owned by a former NFL player as robust as The Bus.  Carnivores will have no problem finding something that sounds good on the menu, and I'm sure the food is up to par with any other steakhouse its size and scale.  Some menu items are noted with a "36" as "Jerome's favorites" (hint: Jerome does not prefer vegetables), while others are noted with a differently colored "36" to show that they are vegetarian.  Those items include a homemade veggie burger, gnocchi, linguini, salads, and a handful of appetizers.  We ordered the hummus, which was pretty bland and had almost no flavor.  Unlike most restaurants, which load you up on hummus and skimp on the pitas, Bettis does the opposite, providing a mound of pitas and a less hummus than you would expect.  We each ordered the homemade veggie burger, which was impressive as a concept (for this type of restaurant), but Jerome needs to talk to some of his vegetarian NFL friends (Tony Gonzalez, Arian Foster) and revamp this burger.  It had little flavor and a sloppy texture and had standard, bland toppings like onion, a massive leaf of lettuce, and a slice of tomato.  The strawberry cilantro dressing sounded great but was barely noticeable.  The best part of the meal was the huge pile of sweet potato waffle fries that came as a side.  We didn't order dessert after being underwhelmed by our dinner.

Price: Jerome has to pay the bills for this amazing location (see below), but the prices are generally fair.  This isn't a cheap meal, but not expensive either.  Appetizers range from $6-13, and sandwiches or entrees range from $10-19 (except for the $54 36 oz. steak).  The special cocktails are a little pricy but there is a full bar with cheaper cocktails and at least one beer special which is more affordable.

Drinks: The bar is the Grille's strongest feature.  There is a huge list of draft and bottled beers, an extensive wine list, a full-service bar and specialty cocktail list, and even IBC Root Beer and Red Bull.  We tried a special cocktail, The Jolly Roger, which wasn't cheap but was made strong and was pretty tasty, before switching to one of the many beer options.

Atmosphere: The restaurant aspect is pretty standard with large and small tables, indoor and outdoor seating, televisions playing sports, and music blasting.  The bar is a huge oval with many seats, a lot of fast-moving bartenders, and even more TVs playing almost any live sporting event that you'd want to see.  The entire place is littered with signed notes on the walls from former Steelers and famous athletes.  Just reading these notes, if you're a sports fan, will keep you busy throughout dinner.  If you're like me, and the Steelers are almost as important as your family, you'll want to try this place once and will probably be somewhat biased in a positive way, like the homer that you are on Sunday afternoons.  The men's restroom has the now famous two-sided mirror that looks out into the bar and front door of the restaurant, which is a unique perspective while relieving your bladder.  Due to its proximity to Heinz Field and Stage AE, the place gets super busy before a big event.  It was packed when we went, but we only had to wait 10-15 minutes for a table for two.  The bar fills up quickly, but there are enough bartenders to get a drink without too long of a wait.  This is probably a good place to watch a game, but is much busier and more frantic than your neighborhood pub.

Service: Everyone was friendly and efficient, particularly the bartenders.  Despite being slammed before a concert at Stage AE, the bartenders were hustling to get everyone drinks fast.  We didn't wait long for a table, put in our order quickly, and had quick refills on waters and drinks.  

(+): awesome location, plenty to drink, owned by a legendary former Steeler

(-): average food, lacks the authenticity of a smaller bar/restaurant, nothing special

Would I go back again? If I had tickets to a show at Stage AE or a game at Heinz Field and forgot beers for tailgaiting at home or it was raining, probably.  Sorry Jerome; watching highlights of thunderous runs with tacklers bouncing to the turf gives me goosebumps, but I wouldn't drive out of my way to come here for the generic food on just any old night.

We stopped in for appetizers with friends.  The service was very good and our server Bryan made some excellent recommendations.  We had the tot cho's which were a very good version of nachos, but with crispy tater tot base, the bacon wrapped jalapeños were excellent as were the sliders with a side of Mac and cheese.

Great food, great service, a great place to go before any Pittsburgh sporting event.  We have been there 3 times,  and never have had an issue.  The dry rub wings are out of this world.  I ate there with a champion wing maker.  He made fun of me for ordering the dry rub wings.  However, he ate half of my dozen and started on his own dry rub when we returned home.  Tbe Barnyard burger is up there with the best burgers I ever had.  I would have given it a 5 star rating, but the prices are a little high.  Not high enough to keep me from going,  But high enough to limit my trips.

Not too bad. Our server was lovely and the setting was really great! Outdoors, by the river, with fairy lights hanging... beautiful! I ordered the linguini bruschetta pasta and asked for no cheese, but it came with cheese. I didn't send it back because it took so long to arrive the first time, so I ate around it. Also, the balsamic glaze was far too overpowering so I had to eat around that, too. What I did eat was nice, though, and my boyfriend enjoyed his meal! I would go back again!

Diners go to restaurants so that they can become involved in the personal lives of the people who work there, and this restaurant excels at creating and sharing that experience! And every once in a while the staff bothers to be interrupted to find out what a diner wants and if everything is okay. What more could you ask for? A cooked steak, for one. I asked for medium rare, and I got a raw slab of meat with score marks on each side. The waitress sided with the cook, until I insisted that medium rare still meant cooked. The vegetable...well, the menu had promised a seasonal vegetable of zucchini, squash, peppers, and onions, and once I pointed this out to her, she had the stalk of broccoli that the chef had plated next to the mooing steak removed and brought me the promised side dish--about ten minutes before she returned with a slightly overcooked steak.  Broccoli...mixed vegetables...honoring what's promised on the menu. Why be so picky? It's the hip place to be! You can listen to the staff's preferred choice of music and hear about their social lives at the same time! I won't be back.

I went here before a Pirates game and was a little disappointed, both with the pirates and the restaurant.  I love wedge salads and order them anytime they are on the menu.  This particular salad was $8, so I knew it was gonna be big which was ok since I was planning on splitting it.  Well, it was literally a head of lettuce with dressing drizzled over it.  As you might imagine, a coating of dressing over 1 piece of lettuce is not enough for an entire head of lettuce.  The burger I shared was ok, a little undercooked, not the best.  Our waiter brought us the wrong beer, so we got to keep the mistake for free which I guess makes up for the bad wedge salad.  

The menu had a good selection of food.  Mostly burgers.  Everything was presented very nicely.  We sat outside along the river which was ok except it got a little windy and my poor mother had to sit in the sun since our table seemed to be the only one without an umbrella.  

Oh, and the bathrooms in this joint were so dark!  I had to paw my way around to get where I wanted to go.  This makes me wonder what they are trying to hide. Hmmmmmmm......

As a diehard Steelers fan, it pains me to give this place one star, but this was the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant.

My friend absolutely adores the chocolate cake at this place, so when we were in town for a football game, we thought we'd eat dinner there. Upon entering, the hostess told us it would be an hour and a half wait. It was packed, the night before a Steelers game, so we had expected as much. No big deal. We put our name on the list and went to find seats at the bar.

Upon sitting down at the bar, it took us 25 minutes until the bartender came over to see us. I know they were busy, but it took us nearly a half hour to just get water. We had to resort to flapping our arms to get the bartender's attention.

It was another 20 minutes before we were able to get the bartender's attention - again by flapping our arms - to order drinks.

After almost an hour of waiting, we finally had drinks, and the next half hour passed by rather pleasantly, although we were again completely ignored by the bartender.

After an hour and a half, I went to check with the hostess, who told me it was going to be an additional two hour wait for a table. I told her she had originally told us 90 minutes, but she just shrugged. There's a big difference between an hour and a half wait, and a three and a half hour wait.

Now with both of us a little mad, my friend and I decided to just eat dinner at the bar. We ordered, then proceeded to wait nearly an hour for our food. If it was just me, I would have been long gone, but my friend wanted to stay, so I put up with it.

When my burger did finally arrive, it was ice cold. My friend told me to send it back, but at this point I was upset and hungry and said it was fine. (My mistake!)

Once again having to wave our arms to get the bartender's attention, we ordered dessert, the fabled chocolate cake my friend insisted I had to try. We once again waited 45 minutes, which at this point had become par for the course, only for someone to come out and tell us they had dropped the chocolate cake on the floor and didn't have any more. So I never even got to taste the whole reason my friend and I went to the restaurant.

To add insult to injury, a manager came out and said she wouldn't charge us for the chocolate cake, as if they were actually thinking about charging us for something they had never served us.

Four hours after we walked in the front door, we left the restaurant with no apology, no comped drinks, nothing.

And did I enjoy the Steelers game the next day? No, I did not. I made it through about a quarter and a half before I was in the bathroom puking. When I got home and saw my doctor, he said the most likely cause was food poisoning caused by undercooked meat.

Needless to say, I will never be returning here.
I just love this place! I have been there many times and its always been very good. The atmosphere is great especially if your a sports nut. Plenty of TV's, great food and an endless list of beers.
Unbelievably Mediocre. I believe I did not get the correct thing off the menu, however the party of seven I was with gave similar opinions.

Good spot to grab a drink before the game. Beer prices are reasonable considering the proximity to Heinz Field. Service is slow when ordering drinks at the bar, not sure about table service as I haven't used it.

I hope Jerome Bettis is reviewing, step your customer service up ASAP!  I do not want to know that the bartender "gets moody" when I've asked for bar specialty shot. If I want to spend money on booze and food for a steeler game, sadly it will not be here ever again. The staff feed on the busy entrance, communicating to the prospective customers a 2+hour wait- please know it took us 20 minutes to be seated at a table on game day. horrible. Jerome come check your staff and please train out waitress Alisha. P.s who serves crown and pitrone warm?!?!

My husband & I were hesitant because of our boys.
It turned out we loved it. The food was delicious,  great service & beautiful view. The waitress let my kids go in into the little private room with all the Jerome Bettis memorabilia. Its was cool. They have really good martinis!  Spinach dip...best ever!

Service was a little slow at the bar but it was a Sunday evening. Great Big Screen televisions with good visibility  from all areas of the bar. Food was good though! Kind of a unique menu with some homemade options.

I went to a party at the Bettis grill we had a reserved area and was to have staff available. Well theres was non exsistant service after 30 minutes I went to the bar to get a water. It took another hour to find anyone to take an order which I just left & went somewhere else. My food was dry, cold, over cooked  & not done as I ordered it. The Jerome burger came out almost burnt, cold & missing all toppings. My other order was also cold but looked greasier than a turkey burger should. It was also missing the sweet potato fries what I got was some over seasoned old fries. Again it was done done as I expected it to be, what a big let down.

Then to top it off I pay the waiter and wait & wait for my change guess what no can find the waiter. He took off with my money, I looked for him for over half an hour for him never saw him again. Funny I was going to give him a bigger tip than wat he stole!

So if your down with terrible service, ordinary over priced food & thief for waiter then this is the place for you. I'll never waster my money again & make sure I spread the word about the thief.
Food is amazing.  Tried the mac and cheese, best I've had in a while.  Fun place to watch games, or pre-game for a Steelers or Pirates game.

with all due respect - this is not my type of place to frequent: Nice place, clean,  upscale sports bar with a dining area. The popularity of other local venues keep them alive in my opinion. This place would have to step its game up significantly if it were in any other location- nothing really jumped out at me.  the staff is awesome; friendly and informative.

Meh...was expecting higher than average sports bar fare but was disappointed. Staff was friendly and service was okay. We tried a few appetizers and entrees and noticed the lack of fresh ingredients and overcooked or undercooked meals. Great location but c'mon BUS!  You can do better.

I'm never coming here again. I am writing this as we are here. We are a large group at a high table in the bar area. We told the server that we would take care of her because we would be here all evening to watch the STANLEY CUP FINAL. She barely showed up. Service was so bad, we gave up on her and just ordered from the bar. 

The absolute worst part, though, is the DJ. They have the TV volume turned off when the puck is not in play, and instead some idiot DJ who clearly has never watched a single game of hockey is blathering on and on, reminding us that we are watching the Penguins play a game. A lot of people were expressing their displeasure over the fact that we couldn't hear any of the pregame commentary. One of our party found a manager and asked that they put the TV volume on, and the answer he got was, "We turn off the DJ when the puck drops. That's just how we do it here." Idiots. Idiots. Idiots. They are absolutely killing the atmosphere. 

I thought this place was annoying during football games with the DJ coming on during every commercial, but this is beyond the pale. Seriously, never again. If I could give zero stars, I would.

Great service, clean, unique atmosphere, and extra bonus for the men who need to use the restroom. ;-)   I got the turkey burger, and it was quite possibly the best I've ever had... seriously.   Also got wings that were tasty.  Not terribly pricey.   Definitely recommend this place if you are downtown.
Reasonably priced and food was delicious!! My husband loved the fried Italian hoagie.

Great atmosphere

Nice bar area to dine  for a quiet afternoon after the Heinz field tour.  outside seating by water also great to have if weather was nice.   

To the food

Korean BBQ tacos not up to par.  Beef ok but too thick like skewers of beef instead of true Korean bulgoki.  The best part was the side salad with a kick o wasabi in sweet dressing.

Turkey Parmesan burger was great.  Big piece of meat. A good 1/3 of pound it seems made like a pizza burger.  Sauce was great and they did not overstuffed it with mozzarella.  Great dish around the bar.

At first I  was a bit duds appointed that they were our of many items 
your waitress was incredible and the marighirrsa even better

4 stars. Cool sports bar in between PNC Park and Heinz Field. This place quiet possibly has one of the coolest bathrooms ever (you will have to experience it for yourself). Ordered a couple of IC lights before the Pirates game.

We went here and I couldn't decide what to get! We ended up with the deep fried pretzels, (while awesome, way too big of a serving for 2), and I got the deep-fried cheeseburger. It was the Best. Cheeseburger. of . My. Life!!!
Prices were surprisingly low considering it's downtown on the river.
The wait wasn't great, but it was a Saturday around dinner-time with a Dave Matthews Concert down the street... So I wasn't shocked at our 25 minute wait.
Service was fantastic. The server admitted to being new, but still blew me away. 
I will definatly go back, just to try the things I didn't get last time.

Got here about 3 hours before game time and were able to sit right now at the bar.   Ordered an appetizer with plans to order a main course later. After a long wait - they brought us the wrong appetizer.

Had to wait a while for the right one and when it came finally got to order our main meal.  Got the signature 36 burger.

Over 45 minutes later it arrived... Cold.  No one asked how it was or how we were doing.

The burger and fries tasted like Applebee's quality but cold. Waste of time and money.

Visiting the city for a pre-season Steelers game, we had to stop here for dinner. I'm glad we did. Friendly waitstaff, pleasant atmosphere (not loud, maybe that's in the bar, where you would expect it to be loud), good food. I had the chicken quesadilla, which was prepared differently than I am used to but I loved it.  I didn't think it was expensive at all as some other reviewers thought but, hey, I'm visiting from metro NY so perhaps my expectations are different.
Waiter was absolutely adorable and super nice, oir drinks and refills were so quick. Great staff. But the pasta primavera was overcooked and mushy.

They have a pretty wide menu, but it's generally a more unhealthy fare, such as the deep-fried Italian hoagie. The turkey burger is pretty good. Portion size is good, and it's more likely you'll leave stuffed than hungry. Service is horrible. We waited 40 minutes for food and they weren't even that busy.

I've been here several times and I love it. The beer selection is endless and the food is good. The only reason that I'm giving the Bus 4 stars is only because my favorite dish "the blackened tuna" is no longer on the menu which is very disappointing to me. Other than that it is a fantastic place to eat, hang out and watch a game.

Fantastic Bartenders, the best in Pittsburgh.  Amanda is the best. Dave, Julia, and Marybeth are fantastic. Missy is always ready to serve, Only complaint is Julia is waiting on tables instead of serving at the bar.

After a horrible experience 3 months ago we decided we would try again.... Once again we left disappointed.  The fortunate thing was that we didn't waste our time sitting down.  We showed up and the dining room was half full, at best, we were told that it would be a 30-35 minute wait!!  I asked why, when the dining room was empty, and we were told that they were seating all of those table soon..  Only a handful of people were outside and the bar was empty.  I am sure the issue was that they were highly understaffed both from a server and kitchen perspective.  I am sure this place will be out of business once Burgatory, Toby Keith and North Park Lounge open up.  So if you want to eat there.... save your money!!!

Maybe there would be another star if I had actually gotten to eat my dinner at the restaurant. 

We picked this place because we were staying in the area and their menu had a variety of items.  We ordered one gourmet Mac n cheese, an 8oz sirloin, and a burger.

The food showed up about 25 minutes later, after we waved down the puzzled looking person holding what appeared to be our order.

The side of broccoli ordered with the mac consisted of two small pieces. With the steak, which was supposed to be served with 'seasonal vegetables' - a squash medley, was served with a crown of broccoli.  Not cut apart or anything, and barely cooked. Unfortunately it was served to someone who can't eat broccoli and was expecting the vegetable that was listed on the menu. The seasonal veggies were a mushy mess of onions, peppers, and a few pieces of zucchini. Not a great start.

The person who delivered the food went back to request a different veggie for the steak. We disintegrated let him take the rest of the plate, which ended up being a good thing because it gave us a chance to check the steak.

Steak was ordered medium well, sight pink. What came was tough, burnt, and brown all the way through. Finally flagged down a waiter and sent back the steak plate. The only thing on the plate that seemed correct was the sweet potato fries

The manager came and apologized, promising an 8-minute wait. 15 minutes later, after everyone else was done, we still didn't have a steak. Flagged down the waiter (where was he????) and asked for the check. After the check arrived (excluding the missing steak), a to go box arrived with the steak. We left and headed for the hotel.

Cut into the steak, and it was barely medium - really red throughout - after a 20-minute walk in a hot box. There were some greasy, limp green beans, and sweet potato fries coated in sugar. Yuck! The first set of fries didn't have any sugar. It feels like their cooks have no idea what's on their menu, nor do they cook anything consistently. Microwaved the steak - gross, I know, but when you're hungry, you do crazy things. Threw out almost all of the veggies/fries and about half the steak (chewy/gristle). Not sure that was better than cereal from the hotel. Sigh...

Do not recommend. Staff not friendly. Hostess gave us the impression she was doing us a favor.  When I asked for a chair that didn't have food spattered on it the waiter huffed at me. Asked twice for a kids menu. Ended up getting our own. Could use improvement on the service

I'm from out of town and stay around North Shore when I visit. Jerome Bettis is my favorite place to go for lunch and dinner. Your dining options around the stadium are sports bar or sports bar, so a sports bar has to be somewhat competitive. I mean, there are only so many things you can do to a burger and beer to keep folks coming back.

The atmosphere is a little more upscale and clean than most sports bars. It's definitely classier. 

The menu is your basic fare - burgers, sandwiches, salads, etc. I had the nachos once expecting a typical appetizer. They should have called it "Nacho Mountain" it was so huge, and would have fed all 4 of us sitting at our table with no issues. Good beer selection and a full bar, although I usually just do beer when I'm there.

I've had both lunch and dinner there and the service has always been good. Nothing exceptional, but they get the job done and make me feel welcome to be there.

If you're by the ballpark and want to grab a burger but still want to impress your date, this is the place I would go to.
LOVE this place! It's my favourite townie bar and a great place to watch any Pittsburgh game!
Home of the best burger I've ever had l. The burger 36 is delicious and I recommend it to anyone in the Pittsburgh area. I love the steelers decor and memorabilia true to satisfy a fan.

Service was the worst. After 2 hours of waiting, we had to leave.  Sorry Jerome, love you, not the service at your restaurant. Traveled all the way from So. Calif to experience this.  So disappointed.  We had an appetizer that was delist, hence the 1 star rating.

Ate here on a Sunday in September to watch some football. First the service is fantastic. Our waiter worked especially hard to fill up my drinks without even asking. The men's restroom are really cool it's a one sided mirror where you can look over the whole bar. The atmosphere especially while watching the games was electric. Would really recommend this place for a lunch break or even a night out

First time to the restaurant. Went the day before a Pittsburgh Steelers game and after a Saturday Pitt University game at HEINZ Field. Very busy but we were seated fast. It took a while to get a waiter and a couple of drinks, but the nachos we ordered came out fast and the main courses even faster. It was a bit cold out but the food was good [not excellent] and the view over three Rivers was nice. A bit pricy for 3 people with only 1 drink each was just under $100 with tip, but that should be expected for a niche restaurant.

We ate here twice and had different experiences; 1 good, the other bad. The pasta was great for our 8 year old and the flatbreads were very nice. I cannot remember the dish but it was deep fried with cheese and shrimp on the inside. This was not so good. I was hoping for something different and above par given the hype of the place, but it turned out to be just another average sports bar.
I really hate to even give this place one star. Awful service. Truly awful. And we had serious money to spend. Oh well!  There are other options in the area thank goodness.
Their bloody mary is a joke. You could make a dozen bloody marys with the cheap vodka and mix they make their drinks with for the price they charge.

So this place HAD been in the running for a wedding rehearsal dinner... not anymore. 

When the fiance and I arrived, we were seated right away by a girl who was dancing and speaking with coworkers as she walked us to our table. Ok, no biggie. She's just quirky. Our server could have been a football player himself and was nice enough. Fiance ordered a steak and I ordered the brioche-crusted salmon. Since we were looking for rehearsal dinner places, we figured we should get grown-up food and not burgers or sandwiches, and quite honestly that may have been our mistake.

The steak was alright... it's hard to make a steak bad in my book. It definitely was not cooked medium well as he had asked for. I'm a medium rare steak person and it was right on the cusp of being too undone for even me. It had an odd taste to it that wasn't bad, but wasn't necessarily good either.

As for the salmon... well... I probably won't come here again based off of it. The description said that it was brioche-crusted and I believe it also said there was some sort of pesto on it also. The waiter explained when I was ordering that the ratatouille that came with it had a red sauce. I didn't realize that the salmon would also have it. I ALSO didn't realize that the "red sauce" was tomato sauce. On salmon. Without any sort of pasta or starch. I had asked for mashed potatoes based on the fact that I didn't want red sauce veggies, and in my mind this would a been the cue for our server to inform me that the salmon also had it. Mind you there was nothing listed on the menu about it having tomato sauce. The fish itself was overcooked also which made it impossible to eat without the sauce giving it some sort of moisture.


Now I would only read this if you are wedding planning, as it is more of a rant, and won't necessarily be helpful for everyone:
My fiance recommended this place to me as being somewhere that was "Pittsburgh" for our rehearsal since my family and friends are from out of town. We loved the idea of being right on the river and the patio outside, and it's really the best option to chose from being the other ones are Tilted Kilt (nope) and McFaddens (love it, but it is LOUD!) So I decided to use the website and requested info regarding events as they had that option listed. Nothing. Emailed again, still nothing. Since this was a place that fiance really seemed to have his mind set on, I called. The girl that I spoke with was very helpful while on the phone. She stated that she would email me that day with event menu samples and she would research the date to see if there were any Pirates games or concerts she could find yet. This was 3 weeks ago and I still have not heard back from her. I've given up. Even though the location would be perfect, I would be terrified until the day-of that they would forget our group of 26 was coming in.

Horrible service!!  From walking in and standing at the bar where two bartenders looked at, then ignored, me to finally getting a table, which wasn't cleaned from the previous occupants not even when then the waitress showed up.  Either they were NOT trained properly or rudeness is acceptable.  Other than socializing I'm not sure wth they were doing.

This is probably the best Sports Bar in Pittsburgh.  The amount of TVs here is just RIDICULOUS.  I mean, any game you want is on, with labels on all the TVs telling you what will be on.  It's very well planned out!  Food has been pretty great for me, as a seasoned lover of American bar food.  Any place that serves a deep fried cheeseburger or italian hoagie is allright by me.  The portions are large and everything has been well-prepared every time I go.  The bar has a great selection of craft brews and liquor, but don't go by the drink descriptions written on their drink menu...I've caught them cutting costs subbing out cheaper liquors for what is labeled on the menu as premium (triple sec for Grand Marnier, for example).  Otherwise, it's a great place to sit outside and have some great bar food and a beer.  

Oh and guys...make sure you check out the bathroom...the urinals have a 2-way mirror that lets you watch the bar while you pee...very unique!

Very close to football and baseball stadiums. 

Lots of TVs. I loved how they had magnets underneath each TV showing which games that TV would show.

30 beers on tap.

Very friendly and attentive waitress.

Mac and cheese was awesome.
Excellent wait staff and large variety menu. Trying to cut out carbs and the selection of food is fantastic. Bryan our bartender was great, very friendly and attentive.

Slow. Slow. Slow service.  Several empty tables but the kitchen takes forever.40 mins to get wings for an appetizer. Sports vibe. OK beer selection, decent pub like fare. If you are in a hurry, go somewhere else.

restaurant très design, entre le stade des fameux steelers de Pittsburgh et celui des Pinguins, avec terrasse avec vue imprenable sur cette super ville , plats divers, variés frais , portions très généreuses, doggy bag possible, vu les portions!!!!

On 12/21 I went for lunch with a few friends.  The food was great - spot on.  SW Club, Bus Steak Salad, Barnyard Burger and Chicken Caesar Salad.  All worthy picks.  I'm writing this to commend the great service.  Our server was Darkel and we did also meet the Manager - Eugene.  Darkel was professional, polite and friendly.  I would call Eugene a 'restaurant ambassador'.  This man is a good as it gets and we all appreciated his attention.  You have options in the area but this is the place to visit!  Enjoy, dine well.

The ultimate Bar and Grille for Pittsburgh sports fan.The food is diverse and good.The service is very friendly and the prices based on location are reasonable.Being this close to sports stadiums it's easy to gouge patrons.See LA Live next to the Staples Center in Los Angeles.For my money the deep fried hoagie is just as enjoyable as a Primanti Bros. sandwich!Thanks 36!

We were in Pittsburgh exploring the city over the Easter long weekend - 2 adults, 3 kids aged 11,8,7. My husband had heard of this place before, and tour guide on Gateway Clipper reco'd it. We ended up driving around the downtown area but a lot was closed, so we circled back around to Grill 36. It was almost empty, so the service was friendly and fast. Good upscale pub menu, lots of TV's playing sports, good beer selection. We had nachos as an app- amazing. The queso was def house made, as was the chili. For mains, kids devoured mac and cheese, pulled pork sliders, and chicken tenders (the real meat kind!). Fries were hot and crispy. Hubs has farmyard burger - topped with OE egg; said it was amazing. I had pan fried chicken, which was lightly breaded, and served with bacon cream gravy, garlic mashed red skins, and asparagus. It was FANTASTIC. Table next to us had wings that smelled amazing. Server told us 95% of their items are made in house, and you could tell. Thoroughly enjoyed Grill 36.

You don't have to be a football fan to grab a bite here but it helps.  There were tons of items on the lunch menu but I ended up picking one that was just a little better quality than average.  My lunch buddy thought much more highly of hers so I'm willing to revisit the rating after returning for different entrees.  The service was very good although a little slow for a city lunch rush; I'll have to make sure the meeting calendar is clear for an extended lunch hour the next time.

I like the atmosphere here.  It's classy but casual.  Really it's just a good place to grab a decent meal before or during a Steelers or Pirates game if you aren't tailgating or don't want to spend $50 on a few hot dogs.

The food isn't great but it could be much, much worse.  I'd much rather have dessert here than a real meal though.  They actually do pretty well in that area.

Early lunch on a Sunday. Ordered the slider appetizers and a small side salad. The salad was excellent. Nice variety of mixed greens and a tangy honey mustard. The sliders were disappointing. Advertised with a "special sauce", there was nothing but the meat and cheese on a stale bun. I asked for mashed potatoes instead of fries and they were VERY dry. Real potatoes which is good, but lacking adequate moisture to please in texture. OK venue.
Went here for a Pirates Mets game. Mac and cheese is to die for! Decent food.

We were looking for a good bar to hang out at before a concert at Stage AE.  We wanted to sit down for several drinks before heading out.  One bartender took our beer order.  After a few minutes waiting, another bartender asked if we had been helped and we said yes, asked us what our order was and poured it for us.  The other bartender began arguing with us and the other bartender as to who was serving us.  They were clearly irritated with us and each other.  We quickly got our drinks and headed outside where a manager immediately stopped us and said we could not sit out here unless we were being seated to eat.  Although I could understand such a policy if they were very busy, but there was tons of open seating and she was extremely rude.  All of this happened in about 5 minutes.  We sucked down our beers and jetted.  We love Pittsburgh but this will never be on our list again.  The other bars around here were much more fun, accommodating, and fantastic!

tourist trap
noun
a place, as a restaurant, shop, or hotel, that exploits tourists by overcharging.

Keep your $9.00 shots and lackluster service to yourself.  Sorry to say, but if the staff here was Bettis' blockers, he'd have negative yards.  So disappointed.

We went there for our sons birthday dinner. It was our first time there. The manager made us feel like we was the only people in the restaurant even though they was extremely busy. Food was great and our waiter was on top of everything. I can't wait to go back!

Two things that stood out about this restaurant - it is overpriced and it has a great view on the patio of the water and is super close to the stadium.
The medium size wings were a pound of wings for $17, and I ordered the Buffalo garlic sauce, I did not taste any garlic, just Buffalo. The wings were OK overall. 
The deep-fried pretzel sticks were good with the queso. 
The chips & queso was also good and the salsa was quite hot. Though I do not see how the chips & queso were worth eight dollars.
I think I would really only come here to enjoy the view.

I'm not sure when the people with negative reviews visited or who was their server/cook but I had the completely opposite experience. My friends and I got to the restaurant a little late, about a half hour before kitchen closed yet they were more than willing to take us in and serve us. Our server who's name I really wish I remembered was easily the best server I have ever experienced. He was awesome with his knowledge of the menu, beers, and the area around the bar(I'll explain later.)

  We got there and were seated immediately and had our drink orders taken right away after a couple of suggestions from our server on beers. Speaking of beers, I love that the menu denotes which beers are brewed in-state. It was the last day of a weekend trip to the city so we went all out for our dinner. I got the 36 steak which was cooked to perfection. Since it was so late, the kitchen asked if they could butterfly it so it could cook faster which I totally understood and appreciated them just giving me the heads up. All my friends meals were cooked to perfection and they were thrilled with the meals.

 As we talked with our server we discussed how we had been looking for a good cigar bar in the area and were told by a server in another local restaurant that there was none. Our server was baffled knowing there was one right in between Grille 36 and the other business. He went so far as to get the number of the bar and call himself to see if it was still open for us.  

Overall, we were kind of skeptical with mixed reviews, but after our meal Monday night, Grille 36 will forever be remembered as one of the better restaurants I've been to with some of the best staff I have experienced.

P.S. Men should definitely check out the one way mirror in the bathroom, definitely an awesome feature.

I've been here about 5 times and usually it's a great experience. 

The last time I went, the server was awesome, but they must have had their B team in the kitchen. My salad was tasty and everyone else enjoyed their entrees - but when I thought back about it, my salad was missing two of the ingredients that were listed on the menu. But hey, I was tipsy and didn't miss them while I was eating. They were out of carrot cake (basically the reason we came). We got the brownie instead and it was pretty dry. I could have made better out of a box. 

But, overall it's a fun place with good food and big portions!

Very good food,  soup and flat bread were excellent,  enough portion for 2 meals.  Very clean and the service was good and fast with enough time to let me go back to my conference on time.  Also had a burger here once and it was excellent.
Yum...food amazing..Rich is nicest server ever!  Very kind ! Being an Ohio girl...have to say Pittsburgh is beautiful!  Very nice place!

My family and I ate dinner here on 12/27/16 and the service was slow and took forever.  When our dinners arrived, my daughter's mashed potatoes were cold.  The blackened mahi mahi sandwich I ordered was missing the cheese I requested and when the waiter took it back, the chef slapped a piece of cheese on the fish and it didn't even melt.  When we spoke to the waiter about it, nothing was done.   We were very displeased with the food and service during this outing.  Not sure if we will return again.

Beautiful day to sit outside and take in the city while enjoying the Deep fried burger which is a must try!  Boneless wings were on point, Good flavor. Barnyard burger was really juicy and delicious. It was a home run!!

I'm not a Steelers fan but I really do like this place! I like the atmosphere because it does show Pittsburgh pride with showing support for all of our sports. The atmosphere of the restaurant is nice and relaxed, the lights are dimmed. The food is really good and the service is good as well! They have some different food to serve. I recommend the perogie flatbread, it's an appetizer but I had it as my deal and the portion was a good size and it was really good! If I'm down in the North Side, Jerome Bettis Grille is the place I'm most likely to go to.

Monday night I stopped by with my dog as this restaurant came up as a dog friendly place. 
I was seated outside quickly and got service quickly afterwards. The staff was very friendly and brought a dog bowl. I ordered a fat head IPA beer and it was great! I ordered the highest ABV IPA, as I don't usually drink beer much. I ordered the fried chicken entree as there were some food options that the restaurant was out of at the time. Although, my food came out wrong, the staff took care of everything and made things right. I sincerely enjoyed my food and my beer. I will most likely return again in the future.
Good food and great decor, but not quite worth the price. The wait staff where fairly decent. It is more of a sports bar then a Grille.
Awesome atmosphere. Great food and lots of choices in alcohol! Service was fast and friendly! Recommend for any game days or anytime!

Went with 5 other friends on Saturday after the penguin game.  First thing i noticed was the wait time and the many empty tables,  a true sign of poor management.  After waiting 25 minutes, we were seated.  The waitress took our drink order than came back two other times to get our food order without the drinks. I ordered the chips and salsa and it came with a large bowl of salsa with only a handful of chips.   The salsa was excellent but i ran out of chips within a few minutes and since our waitress disappeared they didnt get refilled until my meal was served.  I ordered the deep fried italian hoagie.   Like many things on the menu it sounded better than it tasted and it didnt help that we all sat there for too long with empty beer glasses.   Like this review, Bettis's was just your average sports bar with average food, but the atmosphere was cool and the outdoor seating is a plus so I am sure we will be back.  The stars are for the food only.

After visiting Jerome Bettis Grille on a few Sunday afternoons, I find it to be a mediocre sports bar.  

The hubby orders the BLT Double Grilled Cheese Ranch Burger every time we visit.  It is always cooked as ordered and has scrumptious amounts of bacon and cheese surrounding a juicy burger.  I seem to always steer toward the Ultimate Mac 'N Cheese which is actually done really well for restaurant standards.

The service could be a little better as the wait staff always seems to be being pulled in 100 difference directions.  Also, there are always so many hosts/hostesses just standing around. 

We have never had to wait for a table but know how uncomfortable it would be if we had to as the entry way and hostess stand are practically on top of each other making you dodge people upon entrance and exit.  There has got to be some way to rectify this.

They have televisions at the booth's but we have yet to get a working one.  It either doesn't even turn on or, if it does, you cannot change the channel it is on.

went on a monday afternoon, it was quiet but that's okay. had the street tacos app, perfect amount for dinner and delicious! our waitress dayna was the best, so nice and super helpful. She helped us find out where we should go for the rest of our day in pittsburgh. always a good place to go.

We stopped by last Sunday at 2pm. Non-gameday and not busy. The floor of the bar was dirty with stepped on food and trash. & the bar reeked - the odors given off my unclean bar mats and beer lines that haven't been cleaned out in ages. We had a round & left.

The Burger 36 sounded so good on the menu .. but was a little on the dry and wasn't as flavorful as expected.  Listed on the menu "short rib & chuck infused with bacon" oh that sold me right away, however; it tasted like a burger that I cooked in my toaster oven  with A1 steak sauce.$14.00 - came with fries - that's an expensive lunch. I will give the restaurant another chance and order something different next time I visit.  Maybe "burgers" aren't their specialty.

Reading other reviews, I thought they had an allergy friendly menu but it turns out that it's just a gluten free menu. They don't care about other food allergies like soy. They use soybean oil to fry everything so that cut out half the menu. I'm giving two stars because the waitress was helpful at running back to the kitchen staff to ask if I could eat certain things. The only things I could eat were a salad with oil & vinegar or a side vegetable. If you want a meal and you have an allergy, don't come here. #notallergyfriendly

It was my first visit. I enjoyed it. Very good service from drinks to dinner. Didn't have to wait long, they weren't exactly busy though. The food I did order was very good the "TOT"- chips were nice and crispy and the toppings were amazing. Also I ordered a Sesame chicken salad, very delicious. They only thing I wasn't okay with was the price. I think you're paying for "Jerome Bettis" rather than the quality of the meal. I would return.
Service was great. I ordered an appetizer that was the size of an entree. The drinks we good also. The atmosphere I also enjoyed. Sports played all around. I would recommend it.

I typically wouldn't give a sports bar 5 stars, but I couldn't think of anything wrong with the place! I went at lunch and sat at the bar, and even with only one bartender, service was efficient and helpful. I didn't get a drink since I had to return to work, but I ordered the pierogi flatbread and a side of the legendary mac and cheese. It was ENTIRELY too much food, but man was it worth it! The flatbread was everything I wanted it to be - a great balance of the potato, cheese, and onion, nothing overly heavy. And the mac and cheese... a friend had mandated I get it, and I originally was going to order the entree, but she stopped me in my tracks and said the side was enough. It WAS. The richest, most decadent mac and cheese I think I've ever had! So needless to say, I left about $16 lighter and 100 lbs heavier.

Staff not very accommodating. At 11:00 am, refused to change channels for us to watch rain delayed Nascar. Instead, they had Wimbledon on half the TVs and baseball highlights from last night on the other half. WTH? I guess they didn't need our business.

It has an outstanding location between Heinz field and PNC Park. 

I thought this might be a tourist trap type of place.  But loved Jerome Bettis as a player and decided to go just the same.

The food was very good and the prices were not bad considering its location.  Let me just say this; don't eat here if you are not very hungry.  As one Steeler wrote on the wall, "You can tell this is a big guy's place!"  That sums it up the portions are very large and most of the food is not very good for you.  I even saw a deep fried hamburger on the menu (not kidding).

We got the nachos for an appetizer and could have stopped right there.  It was the biggest nacho appetizer I have ever seen in a restaurant. My wife and I both got different salads which were wonderful but we could not finish because of the nachos.  The kids got cheeseburgers which they could not even eat half of.

The seats are comfortable and there are flat screen televisions everywhere you look.  We saw that several of the booth tables had their own TVs too.

The only negative was that there is no parking expect for the lot across the street and price to park there varies depending on the day and what is going on around that location.  Parking can vary from $5 to $25.
Very good Mac and cheese, and the bulgogi taco was a great appetizer. A little pricey, but very good!!!
Ordered the ribeye medium rare.  Came a bit over cooked and it was dry compared to what it should be for a ribeye.  Certainly not richly marbled as advertised on the menu

This is the only restaurant in the city I can eat in and not worry about gluten contamination! They have wings, French fries, tots all fried up in a dedicated fryer. As usual, make sure to let your server or bartender aware of your gluten intolerance and watch for your food to be served on a circle plate. They even carry Omission beer. The food is good as well as the service.

I came here the Steeler game on Monday night with two of my friends. The space is nice and roomy with a lot of seating. My friends and i found a table at the bar area and sat there. I will start by saying two things: 1) our waiter came right over and asked for our drink orders (i like that) and 2) the bar area was a little busy, not definitely not completely full. He brought us back our drinks and then went on to another table. He wanted to put an app in, but our waiter never came back. Finally when he did, he brought another guy over and said that since they were so busy (they weren't) that they would both be helping us out tonight. A while later, the original waiter comes back over and says "he's taking care of you now, right? Okay good." Then ran away as fast as he came. At this time we were still waiting to put our appetizer order in. Finally about a half hour later, the second guy comes over and asks if we needed anything. (My water was empty). At that time, we put in our appetizer order, some more drink orders, and i asked for more water, because we didn't know when he'd be back. He came back about 10 minutes later with our appetizer and then about 10 minutes after that when our drink orders. A while later he came back to take our dinner orders. Two of us got salads and the third person for a turkey burger. It took almost 45 minutes for our food to arrive and was brought out by someone else. A half hour after our food came out, our waiter came back and was very anxious to give us our check. He did not check to see how our food was nor did he refill our drinks. Once he dropped off the checks, he was very quick to take our checks and bring them back. We stayed until the end of the game and he didn't come back to check on us once we cashed out. He didn't offer any more water or anything. 

On top of that, the food was nothing exciting. I gave this place 2 stars because the atmosphere and warm and inviting and it is a great place to watch a game. But, i probably won't be back.

So we are in Pittsburgh for the Easter weekend. Staying down the street from Heinz stadium.  After our stadium tour, we decided to eat here.  Nice day out so we asked to sit outside.  It wasn't terribly busy. No line or ppl waiting, however the hostess was completely overwhelmed.  Ok so we get sat outside.  The table was wobbly and took about ten minutes for a server to come over.  Such chaos!  Food runners were bringing food to wrong tables...it was terrible.  We finally got our appetizer firecracker shrimp (after it was almost pawned off to three other tables)-it was amazing.   We ran out of drinks halfway through the appetizer---and then our food finally came after they thought they already served it to us.  It was cold!  Our waitress finally brought my husband a beer, it was the wrong one.  I got up two times to refill my water myself.  Really really poor experience!

Do not get the Grown up Grilled cheese,it barely had enough cheese to hold the two pc of bread together, way over priced at $14.00.
My husband did like his chicken sandwich. The service was friendly.
Julia was awesome! And manager Eric helped us Elton our ticket situations , great place good people , great food and fun time!!

Before the Pitt vs VT game . We had a group of 14 and the pulled it off , with a mixed of people in and out at different times . I had the black n blue burger . Great , done as I like . Fries were very good . Service was as good as you could hope on game day .

You're probably thinking how have you lived in Pittsburgh forever and never been here?  I don't know but I know I'll be back. 

We went on a Sunday night when it was dead after the March Madness events in Pittsburgh blew over.  If you're gonna watch sports in Pittsburgh this would be a good option to do it.  TVs are at every angle and I mean EVERY ANGLE, even in the booths.  That was another highlight, huge divided privacy booths big enough for 4 with 6 people's worth of room. Fast, friendly service from our waiter Niko kept the mood perfect.  A large beer/wine selection upped the odds of leaving tipsy.  We ordered the loaded nachos for the appetizer and we loved them.  Enough for 4 people.  For entrees we got the sliders and salmon.  I don't think the food was mind blowing but it was fresh, hot and full of flavor, adequate.  Afterwards we sat and the bar and had a few more drinks because at this point we were highly satisfied with the pace and efficiency of the night.

I'll have to go back on a busy night and see if the execution is the same, but from our first go through I'll say I look forward to going back.  Maybe even get the 36 ounce steak!

Family of four dinner. Pretzel appetizer was best part of the meal. Perogies were mediocre. Pulled pork was served cold and flavor was poor. Fish dinners were very average. Love the 'Bus' but the restaurant will never make the hall of fame.

Being a sports fan, I was looking forward to having a drink and an appetizer at Jerome Bettis's restaurant right next to Heinz Field.  First of all, I was disappointed by the interior.  I expected lots of football memorabilia (helmets, jerseys, photos, etc.)  However, the only thing really plastered on the walls were letters of congratulations to Mr. Bettis from NFL and local celebrities.  The atmosphere was typical of any sport's bar & grill and I had expected a little more from this place based on the name and location.  

We asked the hostess if we could sit near a TV that was showing our favorite baseball team.  When she couldn't find a table near a big screen, she gave us a large booth with our own private, smaller screen where we could change the channel to whatever we liked.  So that was a nice accommodation.

We ended up splitting the nachos which were absolutely huge.  However, we are vegetarians, so we asked if we could substitute the chili for guacamole.  The server asked and the manager said "no".  So we paid the extra dollar for the guacamole anyway and it ended up being served in something similar to the little, plastic, ketchup containers you might get at Burger King.  In other words, we would have needed about 12 of these to match the mound of chips we were given.  Overall, the flavor of the nachos was good, but we were underwhelmed by the restaurant's inflexibility and the tiny portion of our appetizer's upgrade.

This place has a great gluten free menu.  Their steak/ egg/ whatever salad is amazing and their bacon burger AND FRIES!!!!!!!! is likewise delectable.  I'm always a bit impressed when a place can offer me SAFE fries.  They do have a designated gluten free menu... so you just have to ask.  I'm pretty sure everything even comes out on specially shaped plates to fully differentiate gluten from gluten free items.   Overall its a nice place to catch a game, chat with a few buddies, and eat +/- drink.  Parking might be a challenge if its a game night... but there are something like 3 lots within 2-3 blocks that you can pay a rather low rate for the night.

Had to check it out before the Pirates game.  It actually isn't really all that football-y though, other than the huge picture on the one wall.  It feels like any Pittsburgh sports figure could have opened this up and done the same thing, like Louis Lipps or Andy Van Slyke. It's just a kind of fancy looking sports bar that gets away with being overpriced due to the location.  

The one thing that stands out is the men's room, probably one of the coolest public bathrooms I've ever been to.  The two way mirror is a fantastic touch.  Good job by The Bus on that one.

My friends and I celebrated a birthday at Jerome Bettis' Grille and we had a wonderful time! There was 16 of us and they were so nice about accommodating us and it didn't take long for us to get a table. Our waiter, Brian, was wonderful and brought us anything we needed!

We all started off with drinks - margaritas, mojitos, mixed drinks and drafts! The appetizers were great, especially the nachos! For our meals, a few people had the southwest club, that they said was delicious! I had the Black and Bleu burger and it was great! I would definitely go back and like to try the deep fried hoagie. That looked really good!

No doubt Jerome Bettis was an outstanding football player, but I was unsure of his culinary qualities. I decided to give his Grille 36 a try and was pleasantly surprised. The menu is so diverse and features a lot of choices. The pierogies were delicious, as was the Moroccan pomegranate BBQ chicken. On a second visit, I had the Cabo Burger, with shrimp, Monterey jack cheese, and an orange/lime spread. Interesting and tasty, although a bit greasy; I felt a little sick afterwards. I thought well of the service; our waitress was friendly, and the service was quick. Playing a Miley Cyrus song, however, is a black mark. Really Jerome? You're better than playing Miley Cyrus in your restaurant.
Good food, service was ok. The burgers are different but very good. Great selection of local draft beer

Walked in after a long flight looking forward to some lunch.  Entering the front door, there was no one at the front desk.  2 wait staff members walked by and said nothing.  When the phone rang, two girls scampered across the room to answer it as if there was a prize for the first person to answer.  The other girl looked and me and said hello.  I asked if I could sit in the bar area and she said "Sure, it's self-seating."  I picked an empty space along the outside wall and patiently waited while the server was at the table next to me.  I opened my phone to write an email and read a few while I waited....and waited...and waited... After waiting 15 min and receiving no service, I decided to leave.  As I passed the hostess that spoke to me before, she said have a nice day, not even recognizing that I was the same person that had spoken to her just 15 minutes before.  If you want good or fast service, avoid Jerome Bettis Grille 36.  If you have time on your hands, go for it.

On a Friday evening with a baseball game, playoff hockey game, and Alice Cooper concert, this place was popping, but quick and efficient! We waited less than 30 minutes for a table, our waitress was awesome, and the food was spectacular! Don't let a busy night scare you away from this place.
