They ended up charging my credit card an extra $10 for it. Which I don't quite understand. Anyways... If you go here make sure you don't take anything with you even if they say it's ok to.

I came here last night to watch the Pitt game and grab a bite to eat. It was pretty busy but we still managed to get seats at the bar and the service was pretty fast. They have a nice beer selection on tap, and I love that there is also a huge outdoor patio, although we probably don't have many good weather days left this year. I ordered the Mediterranean Hummus and the Spinach and Artichoke Dip. Both came with plenty of pita bread to go around. The hummus was pretty good - it was pretty much what you might expect to get ordering Mediterranean hummus. The spinach and artichoke dip had prosciutto in it, which I have never had before in this type of dip. It was delicious, but incredibly salty so I couldn't eat too much. I didn't order an entrée, although the gentleman next to me had the BBQ Bacon and Cheddar Burger and it looked/smelled amazing. My mouth was literally watering as I watched him eat it.

I will definitely be back to try the Mac and Cheese and the BBQ Burger, and will update my post then.

I will do my best to not let the Steelers loss taint my review of the bettis grille.  This is in my estimation the best sports themed bar in Pittsburgh.  I usually swing by this place when the Steelers are playing at home, but this is the perfect place to watch a game when the steelers are away.  For some reason I always struggle with where to watch the game when the steelers are away, McFaddens is fine, guiness and all that, but the food is awful, the same can be said for calico jack's.  South side is also kind of meh' for Steeler sunday.  Bettis Grille was crowded yesterday, but not overwhelming.  I was there with about 8 people and while we only had one seat at the bar none of us had to wait for any real amount of time for a drink.  The space itself is very nice.  It has a huge football shaped bar with at least a dozen 50' plasmas with every game on.  I would characterize the food as good bar food or close to upscale casual.  I've tried many things here on muttiple visits and never been really disappointed. Yesterday we tried the burgers, which were cooked pretty well on soft buns with decent seasoning and plenty of melted cheese.  The chicken quesadillas were also adequate and the popcorn shrimp was served in style in a chinese box with plenty of veggies and ranch dressing.  They weren't overbreaded and had a nice amount of spice.  There is plenty of parking for $3 and if it's nice enough you can park a few minutes away and make the walk without the cost.  The mens bathroom is somewhat odd.  I mean it's nice enough with marble and plenty of room, but the urinals are facing a one way window out into the bar and maybe it's just me, but I findi it a bit disconcerning to think of a bunch of guys staring at whatever lady friend I happen to be with while they are doing their business.  Maybe it's just me.  I think it's a little overpriced for the booze.  I drank mostly guiness at $5 a draught, seems a little high and had a glass of wine or two for around $10.  Some of the girls ordered lemondrops for $8 a shot, seems a bit pricey, but I tend not to do candy shots myself.  Overall this is a good place and I'll definitely be back again.

Dropped in here when on a quick trip through town. 

Frankly, I was kinda bummed about the food.  90$ for six for lunch including a child and all of our dishes were mediocre at best. Soggy fries that no one finished, overlooked flavorless burgers and dry chicken sandwich.  Each person left less than satisfied. The burgers were clearly not fresh, they looked like the kind you get out of the freezer case. 

Service was a bit haphazard. Kept our drinks filled but didn't put condiments on the table, had to get them myself. 

Server was nice enough though. 

The location and atmosphere held promise and the outdoor seating is great.   Everything else is subpar.

First time I have been able to get in. I am usually in town when the Steelers play and this place is packed then. The decor is fantastic. Our server Yvonne was hilarious and so personable. If you decide to go here, ask for her. My girlfriend and I shared the street tacos (chicken) as an appetizer. The chicken was very moist and the whole thing has just the right amount of kick. I had the 36 burger and she had the blackened fish sandwich with a side of the Mac and cheese. My burger was very good and juicy. I liked the infused bacon. Her blackened fish was spicy. (We both like spicy food but it may be too much for some). The Mac and cheese was great. Their beer selection is good with many local breweries on tap.

I have visited this establishment probably 3 or 4 times over the course of 5 years. Out of those times I've ordered food only once and the other times I was just stopping in before a game to grab a beer. As far as the food goes it was awhile ago but I remember getting the deep fried Italian sub. I think mostly it actually being breaded and deep friend was about the coolest thing about it. Other than that it wasn't anything that great tasting. As far as stoping in here before a game and grabbing a beer I would AVOID this place. I usually only get drug in here because the people I'm with want to stop in and check it out. I know most places around this area especially at game time get busy but this place is not worth your time during a game day. I wouldn't even stop in just to look around as it gets so packed you can barely even move around in the place. The last time I stoped in 10/22/17 was the first time I actually got very rude service from the bartender. You could tell he was overwhelmed by the number of people ordering drinks but there is no reason to  be disrespect to paying customers with a bad attitude. Also if you don't like waiting for 20 plus minutes just to get you and your buddies a quick beer definitely don't try this place. The Tilted Kilt that is pretty much so next door is the place I would recommend 100 times over this place on a game day. They keep things rolling over there and there bartenders slay drink orders left and right. The only time I would give grille 36 another shot would be during a week day but I'll never be out there to try it for that seeing as I'm only in that area for Steeler games.

Very nice outdoor patio by the waterfront. Had the tortilla soup and it was good. The Margherita flatbread with 4 cheeses got my attention and it was really good. It was an appetizer but my instincts said it was going to be big enough, and it was. And then some:) Took a bit of time to get service but the nice waitress made up for it.

The only redeeming quality of sitting at the bar was Nick. He was attentive when our other bartender was not. He took care of her orders. The food was meh. Not a foodie's scene at all. So much potential gone to waste.

Do not even waste your time or money. Stopped in after a Pirates game this weekend and wish we would have went anywhere else. Got seated quickly but the wait time for food was horrendous. Took over an hour for the appetizer to come out. Then our waitress was barely around to question where our food was. Food arrived at the table which included 2 burgers and wings. WARNING: do NOT get the wings. Brother in law eats them frequently and loves them but they were so incredibly spicy it destroyed his stomach and he had issues for a few days afterwards. Spoke to the waitress about it and she said they often have many complaints that the wings are dangerously spicy and inedible. If the wings are that spicy and you have that many complaints, the management should do something about it and at least flag it on the menu!!! The salsa and quesadilla were also spicy but not nearly to the point of the wings. Also its disgusting and unsanitary to find out that when the brother in law went to use the bathroom due to the wings, he sees that the cook leaves the bathroom without washing his hands. Honestly this was a total waste and ruined the night. Will not be returning.

Great place to grab a bite before event or concert! Menu has lots of options and the atmosphere is awesome for families or big parties. Service is as good as the rest of the place. Kevin, our server, anticipated our needs before we asked! Really enjoyed it

Our first stop on our Pittsburgh Wing road trip, we love to stop at unique Wing stops and anything  to do with athletes.  We tried the Buffalo sauce and Asian sauce.  The Wings were good, they were not cooked consistently.  That means some were really crisp and some were not.  We really enjoyed both sauces, the Buffalo had a great consistent heat, and the Asian sauce tasted like I was eating sesame chicken.  They were both very good, and I really enjoyed seeing all "The Bus" memorabilia.

Crowded! This place was packed with people sitting and standing so much so that it's difficult to walk through. Our waitress was very nice but never brought one of our apps and kept disappearing for long periods of time. She was very enthusiastic when we asked how different dishes were before ordering which made me change my order. 
The food was good. Wings, good sauce. Nachos, huge. Deep fried burger, meh. Gorgonzola salad, yum. 
For some reason When we got our bill there were a couple things on it that we didn't order and had to have the waitress remove which took her 30 minutes to do. 
Definitely not a place for a quick bite but if you're there to watch a game the food is pretty good for bar food.

Certainly not returning to this establishment. We waited almost an hour and 10 minutes for the entire party's food to arrive - with a near empty restaurant. Service was poor and I can make better meals at home. We understand why it's not doing well as a restaurant in the North Shore.

went two years ago food and service was great .two years later the service sucked was brought cold food soup that was as cold as it was outside brocclii that was almost raw waited 35 mins. for the waitress to come back had to find a manager just to get my bill they have destroyed the name of the owner by the way the take care of the buissness and treat the coustomers.i won't recommend it again,maybe Jerome bettis should send in a mystery guest so he can see how bad it has gotten,then he might want to fix itso it will be up to his standards .what a waste of a birthday at least the steelers did not let me down.too pricey for the quality of food and service I received
